alert.note: Alert for Washington (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 27 at 11:50PM MDT until July 28 at 2:00AM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM MDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Colorado, including the following county, Washington. * WHEN...Until 145 AM MDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1150 PM MDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause small stream flooding. Between 1.5 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Brunker Creek and Surveyor Creek. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Otis, Platner and Hyde.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause minor flooding of small creeks and streams, country roads, farmland along creeks, and other low lying areas.
